request.description:
This request allows you to get authentication token that can then be used to access all other Adform API services.

The token itself has a total lifetime of 24 hours and expires after 3 hours of inactivity.

Authentication token is set as a global 'Ticket' variable and it can be reused in further requests - headers and json body.

If you want to use global variables please write them in double curly brackets: {{Ticket}}

Request body fields:
1. UserName - mandatory
2. Password - mandatory

This method returns list of own and inherited alerts for specified client/campaign/agency.

You can filter alerts by parsing AgencyId, AdvertiserID or CampaignId in your request URL. One and only one item can be specified. E.g. both AdvertiserId and CampaignId are not allowed.

EXAMPLE: 
v1/alerts?agencyId={{AgencyId}} or v1/alerts?advertiserId={{AdvertiserId}} or
v1/alerts?campaignId={{CampaignId}}


You can retrieve AgencyId and set it as a Global variable using "Get Advertiser" method.

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "Get Advertiser" method.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

request.description:
This service is able to send alerts to your specified e-mail address or a short message directly to your phone number while the alerts themselves can monitor end dates of campaigns, expiration of line items, budget, discrepancies in impressions and clicks etc.

This service creates a new alert. There are 3 different alert levels - campaign, advertiser and agency. 

NOTE: You need to specify campaign level on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts"

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "Get Advertiser" method or campaign dictionaries.

"level" correspond to numbers: 
1 - Agency
2 - Advertiser/Client
3 - Campaign

"levelItemId" depends on "level" set. 
E.g. if "level" = 1 then you have to insert AgencyId

Settings model varies by alert type.

Possible alert types:
1 - CampaignEndDate, 
2 - LineItemEndDate, 
5 - RtbLineItemBudget, 
7 - ClicksWithoutImpressions, 
8 - ImpressionsWithoutClicks 
'settings' value is a number greater or equal to 0.

For alert types: 
3 - CampaignBudget, 
4 - LineItemBudget
'settings' value is a number between 0 and 100.

For alert types:
6 - PriceHigherThanGoal 
'settings' value is an object: 
"settings": {
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time": 1
}

For alert types: 
9 - KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 
'settings' value is an object. 
"settings": {
"trackingFilter": 1, 
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time": 1
}
10 - KpiWinRateNotMeetingGoal 
'settings' value is an object for during: 
"settings": {
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time" : 1,
} 
or for compared to: 
"settings": {
"trackingFilter": 1, // only for KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"comparedTo": 1
}

Available values for TimeType: 
1 - Days
2 - Hours

Available values for ComparedTo: 
1 - Day
2 - Week
3 - Month

Available values for KpiMetric - visits: 
1 - Higher
2 - Lower
3 - Equal
4 - Increased
5 - Decreased
6 - TrackingFilter

Available values for KpiMetric - win rate: 
1 - Higher
2 - Lower
3 - Equal
4 - Increased
5 - Decreased


Tips on request body:
- Type is always a number
- Settings depend on type
- CampaignManager/campaignCoManager value "true" enables CampaignManager or CampaignCoManager to receive alers.

This service updates alert details or its status (using property "isEnabled").

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts/{{AlertId}}"
{{AlertId}} is taken from global variables if set, if not get it from "GET Alerts" method and insert it here without {{}}.

Body has to be the same as in "POST Alert" method. Refer to this method's documentation.

Settings model varies by alert type.
Possible alert types: 1 - CampaignEndDate, 2 - LineItemEndDate, 5 - RtbLineItemBudget, 7 - ClicksWithoutImpressions, 8 - ImpressionsWithoutClicks 'settings' value is a number greater or equal to 0.
For alert types: 3 - CampaignBudget, 4 - LineItemBudget 'settings' value is a number between 0 and 100.
For alert type 6 - PriceHigherThanGoal 'settings' value is an object: "settings": { "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time": 1 }
For alert types: 9 - KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 'settings' value is an object. "settings": { "trackingFilter": 1, "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time": 1 } 10 - KpiWinRateNotMeetingGoal 'settings' value is an object for during: "settings": { "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time" : 1, } or for compared to: "settings": { "trackingFilter": 1, // only for KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "comparedTo": 1 }
Available values for TimeType: 1 - Days 2 - Hours
Available values for ComparedTo: 1 - Day 2 - Week 3 - Month
Available values for KpiMetric - visits: 1 - Higher 2 - Lower 3 - Equal 4 - Increased 5 - Decreased 6 - TrackingFilter
Available values for KpiMetric - win rate: 1 - Higher 2 - Lower 3 - Equal 4 - Increased 5 - Decreased

To update Notification Settings, pass NotificationSettings object. To update status, pass "isEnabled": true. Both changes cannot be made in one call and need to be made separately.

This method deletes a specified alert.

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts/{{AlertId}}"
{{AlertId}} is taken from global variables if set, if not get it from "GET Alerts" method and insert it here without {{}}.

EXAMPLES:

Examples:
v1/alerts/111111/isenabled?advertiserId=00000 (where 11111 is alert id and 00000 advertiser id)

item.name: Default Values
item.description: Banner Default Values service allows you to manage default values for banners. Default name format, default landing page, default banner attributes values, default backup image rule. Default values are stored in campaign level. Default values can be applied for multiple banners when uploading new or multi-editing the existing ones. Getting certain default value returns list of all possible values with default one marked as current.

(00000 - CampaignId, 1 - BackupImageId)

item.name: Html Banners (From Assets)
item.description:
These services allow you to manage and create HTML banners. These services support the use and administration of creative-based banners like html, image or flash, as well as third party banners, links, rotators and video instreams. The banners can be uploaded directly or built from an existing asset while the banners themselves are sent as base64 strings. The banners are stored at campaign level and multiple tags can be created for them.

NOTE: After the banner is created the returned value refers to the operation but not the object itself.

NOTE: If you are constructing a banner from an asset, you need to upload an asset first or retrieve the existing asset's UUID. Please refer to Banner Asset Service for more information.

This API allows sending one large API request with many API calls inside of it. Instead of sending multiple small requests. 
API call as made simultaniously. 

Response is structured the same as a request. i.e. First API request will be first in response and so on.

If there are dependancies, you can use "name" and "dependsOn"
[{"method":"GET", "name":"first-request", "relativeUrl":"v1/campaigns/1"},{"method":"GET", "dependsOn": "first-request", "relativeUrl":"v1/campaigns/2"}]

To exclude headers from response code use ?includeHeaders=false

exec: tests["AlertId was set as a global variable"] =

request.description:
This service is able to send alerts to your specified e-mail address or a short message directly to your phone number while the alerts themselves can monitor end dates of campaigns, expiration of line items, budget, discrepancies in impressions and clicks etc.

This service creates a new alert. There are 3 different alert levels - campaign, advertiser and agency. 

NOTE: You need to specify campaign level on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts"

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "Get Advertiser" method or campaign dictionaries.

"level" correspond to numbers: 
1 - Agency
2 - Advertiser/Client
3 - Campaign

"levelItemId" depends on "level" set. 
E.g. if "level" = 1 then you have to insert AgencyId

Settings model varies by alert type.

Possible alert types:
1 - CampaignEndDate, 
2 - LineItemEndDate, 
5 - RtbLineItemBudget, 
7 - ClicksWithoutImpressions, 
8 - ImpressionsWithoutClicks 
'settings' value is a number greater or equal to 0.

For alert types: 
3 - CampaignBudget, 
4 - LineItemBudget
'settings' value is a number between 0 and 100.

For alert types:
6 - PriceHigherThanGoal 
'settings' value is an object: 
"settings": {
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time": 1
}

For alert types: 
9 - KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 
'settings' value is an object. 
"settings": {
"trackingFilter": 1, 
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time": 1
}
10 - KpiWinRateNotMeetingGoal 
'settings' value is an object for during: 
"settings": {
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"timeType": 1,
"time" : 1,
} 
or for compared to: 
"settings": {
"trackingFilter": 1, // only for KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 
"kpiMetric": 1,
"value": 1,
"comparedTo": 1
}

Available values for TimeType: 
1 - Days
2 - Hours

Available values for ComparedTo: 
1 - Day
2 - Week
3 - Month

Available values for KpiMetric - visits: 
1 - Higher
2 - Lower
3 - Equal
4 - Increased
5 - Decreased
6 - TrackingFilter

Available values for KpiMetric - win rate: 
1 - Higher
2 - Lower
3 - Equal
4 - Increased
5 - Decreased


Tips on request body:
- Type is always a number
- Settings depend on type
- CampaignManager/campaignCoManager value "true" enables CampaignManager or CampaignCoManager to receive alers.

This method returns list of own and inherited alerts for specified client/campaign/agency.

You can filter alerts by parsing AgencyId, AdvertiserID or CampaignId in your request URL. One and only one item can be specified. E.g. both AdvertiserId and CampaignId are not allowed.

EXAMPLE: 
v1/alerts?agencyId={{AgencyId}} or v1/alerts?advertiserId={{AdvertiserId}} or
v1/alerts?campaignId={{CampaignId}}


You can retrieve AgencyId and set it as a Global variable using "Get Advertiser" method.

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "Get Advertiser" method.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

This service updates alert details or its status (using property "isEnabled").

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts/{{AlertId}}"
{{AlertId}} is taken from global variables if set, if not get it from "GET Alerts" method and insert it here without {{}}.

Body has to be the same as in "POST Alert" method. Refer to this method's documentation.

Settings model varies by alert type.
Possible alert types: 1 - CampaignEndDate, 2 - LineItemEndDate, 5 - RtbLineItemBudget, 7 - ClicksWithoutImpressions, 8 - ImpressionsWithoutClicks 'settings' value is a number greater or equal to 0.
For alert types: 3 - CampaignBudget, 4 - LineItemBudget 'settings' value is a number between 0 and 100.
For alert type 6 - PriceHigherThanGoal 'settings' value is an object: "settings": { "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time": 1 }
For alert types: 9 - KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal 'settings' value is an object. "settings": { "trackingFilter": 1, "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time": 1 } 10 - KpiWinRateNotMeetingGoal 'settings' value is an object for during: "settings": { "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "timeType": 1, "time" : 1, } or for compared to: "settings": { "trackingFilter": 1, // only for KpiVisitsNotMeetingGoal "kpiMetric": 1, "value": 1, "comparedTo": 1 }
Available values for TimeType: 1 - Days 2 - Hours
Available values for ComparedTo: 1 - Day 2 - Week 3 - Month
Available values for KpiMetric - visits: 1 - Higher 2 - Lower 3 - Equal 4 - Increased 5 - Decreased 6 - TrackingFilter
Available values for KpiMetric - win rate: 1 - Higher 2 - Lower 3 - Equal 4 - Increased 5 - Decreased

To update Notification Settings, pass NotificationSettings object. To update status, pass "isEnabled": true. Both changes cannot be made in one call and need to be made separately.

This method deletes a specified alert.

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: "v1/buyer/alerts/{{AlertId}}"
{{AlertId}} is taken from global variables if set, if not get it from "GET Alerts" method and insert it here without {{}}.

This method allows you to enable or disable alert inherited from other level.

EXAMPLE:
v1/alerts/00000/isenabled?campaignId=11111 (where 00000 is alert id and 11111 is campaign id)

This method returns a list of campaign attributes, filtered by specified CampaignId. 

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

NOTE: You can filter campaign attributes by parsing CampaignAttributeId.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

This method returns a list of values from a certain campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeIdis required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributesId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

NOTE: You can filter campaign attribute values by parsing CampaignAttributeValueId.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId, 22222 - ValueId)

This method creates a new campaign attribute, which later can be assigned to each banner in order to batch them and sort the reports data out according to the attribute values.

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method removes an existing campaign attribute.

CampaignId and Campaign Attribute Id is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "Get Campaign Attributes" method.

This method adds a new value for a campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeId is required in your request url.

(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method renames existing campaign attribute.

(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

item.name: Stats
item.description:
IMPORTANT: Each user has to have "Reporting Stats API" enabled in User Management section.

Reporting Stats API returns report data consisting of statistics derived from the data collected by the Adform tracking code. Each report is organized as dimensions and metrics. Metrics are the individual measurements of user activity on your property, such as impressions, clicks and conversions. Dimensions break down metrics across some common criteria, such as campaign or line item. When you build a query, you specify which dimensions and metrics you want in your report data.

Returns a list of found applications and their metadata based on specified search keywords.

Parameters:

1. "search" - mandatory. Stands for keywords to search.

This is a batch search for applications (with file upload).

Attached CSV file should have one application name or bundle per one line and should be saved with UTF-8 encoding.

(where xxxx is type)

You can filter inventory sources using these parameters:

This method returns a list of valid deals that are accessible for agency.
This method creates marketplace manual deal.

item.name: Deal Info (for PMP, external and manual deals)

request.description:
This returns information about specified deal.

You need to parse parent source ID, source type and source ID on your request URL.

Example: /dsp/v1/deals/x/y/z
(where x - parent source ID, y - source type, z - source ID)

Available source type values:
3 - PMP deal
5 - external deal
6 - manual deal

This method updates deal state for client division.

You need to parse parent source ID, source type and source ID on your request URL.

Example: /dsp/v1/deals/x/y/z
(where x - parent source ID, y - source type, z - source ID)

Source type values:
3 - PMP deal
5 - external deal
6 - manual deal

Deal state values:
2 - Accepted
3 - Rejected

item.name: All Inventories (campaign or line item scope)

request.description:
This method returns a list of available inventories for a specified campaign or line item.

Please note that either CampaignId or ActivityId is required on your request URL.

Example: /v1/inventoriesoverview/available?campaignid=000000

item.name: Search inventories (campaign or line item scope)

request.description:
This method returns a list of available inventories for a specified campaign or line item and matches specified filter parameters.

Please note that either CampaignId or ActivityId is required on your request URL.

Example: /v1/inventoriesoverview?campaignid=000000

More info about search parameters: 
http://api.adform.com/v1/help/buyer/inventories#!/InventoriesOverview/InventoriesOverview_GetList

This method returns detailed information about specified inventory.

Please note that parent source ID, source type, source ID and campaign or activity ID is required on your request URL.

Example: /v1/inventoriesoverview/x/y/z?campaignId=0000
(where x - parnt source ID, y - source type, z - source ID)

This method returns logo for specified inventory sources. Content value is returned as Base64 string.

You need to parse inventory source ID on your request URL.

Example: /dsp/v1/inventoriesoverview/logos/?id=1
